page.title: 05Tendring Children
page.content: School starts at 9.20am. Many children have to travel quite long distances from the outlying villages. One boy said he would like to travel by horse! We talked to pupils of the top two classes. We were delighted to meet with children who were going to the same Schools as some of us, the two Grammar Schools in Colchester and the Ipswich GPSDT. Most families comprised four, but three had five and three had EIGHT! The main 'craze' for the boys was computing. Several pupils owned horses and the girls enjoyed riding as a hobby. Other hobbies incl. playing musical instruments, collecting stamps, coins and stickers; keeping pets (one boy had 72 goldfish!); tree climbing, sailing and doing magic.
